lexUnit.name: assure.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tell someone something positively in order to dispel potential doubts.

sentence.text: ` A typewriter is normal , " D'Arcy assured .
I do not wish to detract from all the good things about living in the U.S.A. , but I would like to assure ` Contact " readers that life over here is not all sunshine and roses .

Schools Minister Michael Fallon has ` assured " Catholic education officials that extensions at St Bede 's and St Augustine 's RC primary schools are expected to satisfy new funding criteria for popular schools next year .
` Only the game , " assures Nicholas .
“ None , ” assured Endill .
` We always try to be the first to drop our rates when they are falling , but the last to increase them when they are on their way up , " assures Vos .
I believe that he committed himself to assuring that he would never be party to such a thing again if he could prevent it .
Thank you for the soap , mother , which I assure you was put to good use .
I bought it a few months ago and I was assured they were waterproof . "
` But I came down to the theatre and was assured it was suitable for children so we came with open minds , " she said .
I can not assure my children that all will be safe if Hinkley C is built , " she concluded .
I 've taken it upon myself to assure the count that you 're almost perfect .
He said the colonel had assured him that attacks on embassies would not be repeated and difficulties over foreigners obtaining exit visas had been ended .
The merchants assured him that that would do perfectly .
However , when he returned to England he assured his wife that there was still little in Multavia that could be described as entertainment before or after the hour of seven .
He had n't been back , Mrs Chalk assured her , as she prepared to serve a light cheese and fruit supper .
But before she could react , Jake went on to assure her , ` What 's more , you 're wrong to believe I was prying .
Mandy took a look at Charity and hastened to assure her .
` I 'm not jealous , " Zeinab assured him .
I 'm grateful , I assure you . "
Mr Dewar said he abhorred the thought of civil disobedience adding he had been assured by Scotland United members that this was not part of their strategy .
Branson himself was assured by British officials that the government were wholly on his side , and that there would be ` an unholy row " if Virgin was not flying on 22 June .
At the end of his visit Hogg said that he had been assured by Lebanese leaders that all three British hostages in Lebanon were alive .
But I was assured by the nurses that that would n't be the case .
They left when they were assured that no eviction would take place until alternative accommodation had been found for the family .
Meanwhile haemophiliacs had been assured that blood products were free from HIV and therefore safe .
He was assured that he would hear in a few days .
He had assured her he would be able to lead her out of the forest , but so far they seemed only to have become tangled further in its mazy pathways .
Arthur assured her she was ` quite decent " and that Edward would stick to her .
` But I can assure them our umpires will be quite even-handed about checking all bowlers . "
I can assure you she 's a very bright girl .
